title: Use of P3D plugin in competition

content.raw:
Going through the submissions for Phase 2, I noticed that the teams include the P3D plugin in their sensor\_config.yaml file. The P3D plugin provides a ROS published ground truth - true, noiseless pose information from Gazebo.

This "sensor" is not included in the Technical Guide, but in [Sensor Configuration Wiki](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/Creating%20a%20custom%20WAM-V%20Thruster%20and%20Sensor%20Configuration%20For%20Competition) it points to the [numeric.yaml](#!/osrf/vrx/src/default/vrx_gazebo/src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/wamv_config/sensor_compliance/numeric.yaml) file which could be interpreted to suggest that a sensor configuration that includes one p3d sensor is compliant.

During scoring evaluation do we prevent the P3D publications from Gazebo from making it to the team's container - or are they currently allowed to subscribe to ground truth?
content.html:
Going through the submissions for Phase 2, I noticed that the teams include the P3D plugin in their sensor_config.yaml file. The P3D plugin provides a ROS published ground truth - true, noiseless pose information from Gazebo.

This "sensor" is not included in the Technical Guide, but in Sensor Configuration Wiki it points to the numeric.yaml file which could be interpreted to suggest that a sensor configuration that includes one p3d sensor is compliant.

During scoring evaluation do we prevent the P3D publications from Gazebo from making it to the team's container - or are they currently allowed to subscribe to ground truth?
